TextView.android:text:
These tables are a guide only. You should assess the risk presented by each individual client and
complete the client due diligence risk assessment form. Where any characteristics of a client appear
to present a higher risk, you must factor this into the client due diligence process.
credit or financial institution in the EEA
credit or financial institution outside the\nEEA where equivalent AML provisions\napply
credit or financial institution outside the\nEEA where there are no equivalent AML\nprovisions
UK partnership made up of regulated\nindividuals
subsidiary of existing private unlisted\ncompany for which CDD has been\nconducted
UK company listed on a regulated\nmarket
subsidiary of a UK listed company
private unlisted company in the EEA
overseas company listed on a regulated\nmarket
companies with capital in the form of\nbearer shares
higher-risk trust (e.g. a high-risk jurisdiction is\ninvolved)\n
small, unknown or obscure or unregistered\ncharity

overseas public authority that:
• is entrusted with public functions
• has publicly available, transparent and
 certain identity
• has transparent activities and accounting
 practices
• is accountable to a community institution,
 the authorities of an EEA state or is
 otherwise subject to appropriate check
 and balance procedures

other overseas public authority in high-risk
jurisdiction (e.g. Iran and North Korea—the
Treasury issues guidance and lists periodically
that are available on its website, the most recent
being November 2013) HM Treasury—Financial
Sector Advisory Note
